attributes.title: Stock Physical count
attributes.description: The physical stock counted compared to SAP warehouse balances, Bread had  -44.25 loaves variation while polybags had +1658 pcs. The rest stocks had minimal immaterial variances as shown below.
attributes.recommendation: Branch Management should make sure all stock items are well controlled to minimize variations noted.
attributes.effect: Adequate controls are in place as depicted by the minimal variances.

value: The excess poly bags is mainly as a result of Naivas polybags which in most cases have extra bags over and above the indicated number.
Stocks was okay, with minimal variances noted. The stocks controls shall be maintained.
In the prior audit report dated 10/12/2024 all stock items had zero variations except packing materials which had a variation of +1,202 piece.
Current

Stock take was conducted on 28th Feb 2025 to establish whether the physical stocks were matching with the stock book balance generated from SAP system and whether internal controls on stocks were effective.
Apart from the positive variance in poly bags, the rest stocks items are well controlled
Operations/Production Department
To ensure that stock items are adequately controlled to avert losses.

attributes.title: Bread Weight
attributes.description: From the samples picked, bread underweight were noted as follows; 400g CT – 7%, 400g Grande  - 9%, 600g W - 17%, 600g Barrel - 11% while 800g W had 27%
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should ensure the set production standards are adhered to ensure the final products dispatched to the market meets the correct weight standards.
attributes.effect: Presence of underweight bread is an indication that the company is exposed to financial and reputational risks in form of penalties and customer dissatisfaction respectively

value: We The have had issues with one oven whereby the baking time is prolonged leading to excess loss of moisture hence underweight bread

The oven with prolonged baking time is scheduled for check-up.

Random spot check shall be increased to make sure there is weight compliance.
In the prior audit, all varieties weighed had underweight cases with 600g Brown Naivas having high prevalence
Current
From the samples picked, bread underweight were noted as follows; 400g CT – 7%, 400g Grande  - 9%, 600g W - 17%, 600g Barrel - 11% while 800g W had 27%
To ensure that under weight bread does not find itself in the market.

attributes.title: Bread Damages
attributes.description: Audit noted that production damages were averaging at 0.45% of the production and market damages stood at 0.61% of the total sales.
attributes.recommendation:
The branch team should ensure that production processes are adhered to reduce damages cases.

Sales persons should handle bread carefully while in the market to reduce cases of damages resulting from mishandling
attributes.effect: Excess damages exposes the company to revenue loss

value: We have had cases of oven breakdown leading to increased cases of oven damages which are also included in calculating the production damages percentage.
A thorough preventive maintenance on the oven with issues shall be done to reduce cases of production damages
In the previous audit, it was noted that the percentage of average production damages stood at 0.29% of the total production while average market damages was 0.93% of total sales.
Current

Analysis of production and market damages was done for the period 1st Feb 2025 to 27th Feb 2025 to determine whether bread damages were within the desired percentages of 0.20% to total production and 0.50% of the total sales
Both production & market damages recorded for the period exceeded the set threshold
Operations/Production Department
To ensure that the company does not lose revenue through excess damages

attributes.title: Mixing charts analysis
attributes.description: A summarized findings of the mixing charts analysis is as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation:
The branch team should keep up with the production level and even endeavor to achieve 100%.
Recommendable yield achievement should be maintained
attributes.effect: Production capacity utilization is at 96% which is recommendable.

value: We shall maintain the production level to be able to serve all our customer orders
Recommendable production levels achieved, which shall be maintained

In the previous audit, it was noted average yield per bag was190.53loaves per bag, Utto consumption was at 100%, Average production was 72.57 bags per day representing 89.59% of target which is 81 bags per day
Current

An analysis of mixing chart summaries was done for a period of 27 days from 1st Feb 2025 to 27th Feb 2025, to confirm production data accuracy from mixing charts to cash flow and SAP, raw materials usage as per the set BOM and if the set production standards were achieved.
The branch achieved 96% of the production target and average yield of 190.6 loaves per bag which is recommendable.
Operations/Production Department
To confirm production data accuracy from the mixing charts to cash flow and SAP, raw materials usage, target achieved and yield achieved.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
It was noted that, expected cash had minimal positive variance of Kshs +2.
There was no outstanding IOU
attributes.recommendation: The controls in place at the cash office are adequate and should be maintained.
attributes.effect: Minimal cash variation implies that cash accountability is good.

value: This is well noted
In the prior audit, the cashier fully accounted for the expected cash balance of Ksh 157,290 as at 26/01/2025.
Current
Verification of cash held at the cash office was done on 1st March 2025, to confirm cash held by the cashier and whether the set cash operation standards are adhered to.
Cash controls in place are adequate.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure there is proper accountability of all cash collections

attributes.title: Mini shop spot check
attributes.description: Mini shop bread balance and sales proceed were properly accounted as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation: Mini shop attendant and branch management should keep up with the good stock and cash control
attributes.effect: The operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards as depicted by the immaterial variance which implies that the company does not stand to lose money through mini shop.

value: We shall continue to ensure the mini shop is run efficiently
The shop is well managed
A spot check was conducted in the mini shop on 1st March 2025 to assess whether the operation were being carried out in accordance with the established standards.

The shop operations were being carried out in accordance with the established standards as depicted by the immaterial variance noted, however it was noted that customers are not issued with purchase receipts.
Sales Department
To make sure bread transferred are properly accounted for, no credit sale of bread and that sales proceeds are properly accounted for.

attributes.title: Debtors analysis
attributes.description: The analysis revealed that the total outstanding debtors amounted to Kshs. 293,116.65.
attributes.recommendation: The sales Representative should ensure that the outstanding institution balances are cleared.
attributes.effect: Outstanding route balances can lead to bad debts and hence financial losses

value: Sales Rep to follow up on the accounts with balances
We shall work closely with the sales Rep to ensure that the balances for the two institutions are cleared
In the prior audit, it was noted that, customers had outstanding balances of Ksh 176,761.05 while institutions had balances amounting to Ksh 262,959
Current
An analysis of the route balances was done as at 1st March 2025 to ascertain the status thereof.
Outstanding route balances can lead to bad debts and hence financial losses
Sales Department
To ensure that there are no route balances for customers without credit arrangement.

attributes.title: Production efficiency
attributes.description: Production efficiency analysis revealed that the efficiency was 4.45 bags per production worker.
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should keep up with the good control on production work force.
attributes.effect: Efficiency achieved implies that production labour costs are well controlled

value: This is well noted and we shall ensure we maintain.
Well noted and we shall ensure it is maintained
In the prior audit, it was noted that the average production efficiency was 4.32 bags per production worker
Current

Production efficiency was calculated for period of 27 days from 1st Feb 2025 to 27th Feb 2025. The aim was to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.3 bags per worker
The desired efficiency level was achieved and the branch management urged to maintain the standards
Operations/Production Department
To ensure production labour cost is well controlled.

attributes.title: Packing efficiency
attributes.description: The analysis revealed that the average slicing efficiency for the period was 88.06 crates per slicer.
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should ensure slicers are hired based on the workload and also they should be pushed to achieve the set efficiency
attributes.effect: Packing efficiency of 88.06 crates per slicer implies that the company incurred Kshs 25,536 on extra slicers hired

value: We shall push the hired packers to achieve the desired efficiency.
The efficiency is not good and we shall push to ensure there is improvement
In the prior audit, it was noted that  the average slicing efficiency for the period was 93.80 crates per slicer
Current
Packing efficiency was computed for 27 days from 1st February2025 to 27th February 2025 to determine whether the set company standard of 97 crates per slicer was being achieved.
The actual efficiency was below the KPI
Operations/Production Department
To ensure that production labour cost relating to bread packing is well controlled.

attributes.title: Mileage analysis
attributes.description: It was noted that most branch vehicles were saving on fuel consumption. TukTuk KTWC 581Y had faulty odometer and mileage could not be established. Mileage analysis was as illustrated on the table below
attributes.recommendation:
Branch manager should continue to ensure fuel consumption all vehicles is controlled and within the set standards.

Review of consumption rates for the motor vehicle with significant saving
attributes.effect: Standard rates which are not matching with actual consumption may lead to wrong decision when fueling.

value: We shall continue to monitor the fuel consumption
Branch mechanic working on the faulty odometer of TukTuk KTWC 581Y

In the prior audit, it was noted that vehicles for Maasai Mara, Narok, Town and Ewaso had consumed more fuel. 
Olkalaou, Njambini and Releiver vehicles fuel should be adjusted to match the actual consumption.
Current
Motor vehicle fuel consumption analysis was done for the period 1st February 2025 to 28th February 2025. To evaluate compliance with set fuel standard for each vehicle.
The standards rates need to be reviewed to align with the actual consumption for the vehicles with significant fuel saving
Transport/Fleet Department
To evaluate compliance with set fuel standard for each vehicle

attributes.title: Generator  fuel consumption
attributes.description: The consumption rate for the period was 24.4 Litres/Hr. There was variation of 16.77 hours between the actual engine run hours and system hours.
attributes.recommendation: The branch manager should ensure that the consumption rate does not deviate from the monthly average rate and he should raise query in case of variations

value: Generator fueling is guided by the fuel tracking system personnel

The generator consumption rate for the month of January 2024 was not calculated because the genset was half empty and we could not get the litres to buy from the personnel who’s in charge as it was a weekend.
Physical records for engine hours, fuel usage and refills were analyzed between 1st February 2025 and 28th February 2025 to establish the consumption rate.
The Consumption rate was within the average month by month rate
Transport/Fleet Department
To ensure generator fuel consumption is well controlled.
